intro: Bidens riedelii var. hassleriana, commonly known as the Hassler's tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces yellow flowers with dark centers, typical of the Bidens genus. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have serrated edges. It thrives in wetlands and disturbed soils, showcasing adaptability to moist environments.
